alert.note: Alert for Book Cliffs (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 17 at 2:56PM MDT until June 17 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 487 BELOW 6500 FEET... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 487... The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds, low relative humidity and dry fuels, which is in effect from Sunday afternoon through Sunday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Utah, Fire Weather Zone 487 Book Cliffs below 6500 feet. * WINDS...South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph on Sunday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent on Sunday. * IMPACTS...Dry lightning will likely cause fire starts in the afternoon and evening hours on Friday. Many if not all of the storms will bring a threat of gusty outflow winds. * THUNDERSTORMS...Will form early in the afternoon and continue through the evening hours on Friday. The biggest threat will occur late afternoon through the early evening hours on Friday. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusty and variable winds of 40 to 50 mph are possible from any convection that forms.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
